description: Start the evening off with some beer/cider (Brewery Location). Choose your live edge board and enter the woodworking space and try your hand at making your very own board. You will acquire some introductory woodworking skills from Lavigne & Co Design's Founder Sarah Lavigne as she walks you through de-barking, sanding and oiling your board! At the end of the class you will leave with a beautiful charcuterie board and some new woodworking skills. Depending on ticket, some may include individual charcuterie snacking box with assorted meats, cheese, fruit etc.

reviews.title: Unhappy customer
text: My husband bought me this workshop for my birthday back in August for Toronto location . After he bought them , he was told that that location was no longer available but changing to Niagara on the lake . So after trying to make it work we placed a date in Nov actually sat nov  18 to be exact . Planned the accommodation for that stay so our drive back and forth was not done as live in Vaughan 1. 5 approx away . Then the day before fri Nov 17 we received an email cancelling the said workshop . This now is the second time . I strongly recommend not to book anymore . We end up losing 149$ hotel . This disruption was not satisfactory. They should have let us know at least a few days before not the day before as it was too late . I will never book again . Please be aware .

reviews.title: You’ll Never Be BOARD at This Experience!
text: Doing the charcuterie board workshop was the best decision EVER: We were welcomed warmly at the brewery, which is spacious and clean, and the patio space was beautiful!!
Diane seemingly performed magic while teaching us how to dress a charcuterie board, filled with delicious cheese and fruits and even how to fold coldcuts into little roses!!

Then it was time for Sarah to host the woodworking: the walnut boards are incredibly solid yet light, and we had a blast sanding and using cool tools to whittle and oil our boards into something beautiful and original.
What a unique and worthwhile evening of fun, food, great value, and AMAZING HOSTS!!

reviews.title: Probably wouldn't do it again
text: The host was personable and polite, very knowledgeable. I did a workshop with my sister at the end of August (a post birthday celebration). They discussed a lot care and products you can buy. The actual class was great and a fun experience but pricey.   I loved my board, however I never actually used it because I want to save it for a special occasion. A couple months passed and I noticed a split going down the center of my board. I messaged the woman I booked the class with and she didn't really seem to care and didn't offer any advice about how to fix it. She merely said that imperfections make our boards beautiful. Guess I should have just bought one from a big box store.

reviews.title: Charcuterie Workshop Fun at Sandbanks Winery
text: My friend and I took the Charcuterie Board Workshop at Sandbanks Winery last Friday and it was absolutely fantastic! Emily and Elaine were wonderful hosts and walked us through the fun workshop with lot of wine tasting from Sandbanks Winery.

We had a sunny and beautiful afternoon and the course is fun and easy. All the tools are included and Emily is full of great knowledge. Elaine was a perfect host and ensured we tasted some wonderful wines.

I would recommend being ready to purchase some wines, definitely buy the cheese knives and mineral oil from the workshop and Elaine recommended the lavendar field which is a short drive away (MilleFleurs).
Thank you for a wonderful course!

reviews.title: What a fun night making a custom charcuterie board!
text: I would highly recommend taking this class if you like wine, cheese, charcuterie and you like to make stuff out of wood! When we got there Sarah and her team made us feel so welcome and comfortable, they had wine for us and soon they gave us a lesson on how to set up a well balanced charcuterie board. Then we got to eat it! And then we picked out our special piece of live edge maple that would become our charcuterie board to take home. There was lots of instruction and even if you are not that comfortable around tools, there was lots of help and we all were helping each other! A great way to spend a Friday night with chill people!

reviews.title: Charcuterie board Class
text: I had such a great time in this class! Sarah was an amazing instructor. I would 100% go back to another class (in fact I am keeping my eyes open for more things to come). Looking forward to creating something new in the future!

reviews.title: Came to make a charcuterie board and got so much more...
text: I came to the event expecting just to make a charcuterie board but was pleasantly surprised that the class also included charcuterie tips and tricks, food and wine. It was an intimate class size so you were able to interact with your fellow classmates. The class took place at The Custom Table workspace so I had a chance to tour the space which was beautiful and filled with beautiful pieces by the owner Sarah, I want to remodel my place now lol. Truly a fun experience that I would reco to anyone who likes entertaining at home. It's not often you have the opportunity to create something.

reviews.title: Fabulous Friday Fun
text: I enjoyed the custom table company event "Build your Own Charcuterie  Board" so much I have been twice! Everything was thought out and well put together; from creating the design of your board with the different meats and cheeses. Then using my hands to actually create my own board for my home. I also have one to give as a gift which i am thrilled about. Thank you so much for an amazing night - I hope to one day be able to build a table for my home.

reviews.title: Fab and delicious experience!!!
text: For someone who seldom works with his hands, this was such a great experience and kind of therapeutic. Something about working with wood that had me giddy the whole night. Sarah is a delightful host who clearly loves what she does and knows her stuff. The charcuterie lesson before hand is a nice compliment so you can leave confident the next time you want to entertain. I went solo which was great as you get to meet great people but I can totally see this as a thing for couples or small groups. Take the plunge and get your hands dirty. You’ll leave with a smile and a great looking charcuterie board. Highly recommend!

reviews.title: Amazing Experince!
text: I had THEEE BEST TIME at this workshop!! It was not only so incredibly fun but also very informative. I learnt so much from the lovely Sarah. Oh and not to mention the charcuterie & wine, yum!! Highly reccomend this workshop for your next date or girls night!

reviews.title: A fun and exciting evening!!
text: Okay first of all I didn’t know if this was for me or not or if I was going to get anything out of it but boy was I wrong. I learned so much, everyone who ran the event and the people who joined the class made it that much more enjoyable and comfortable. Sarah answered all my questions and made me feel like I had the best charcuterie board (even though she told everyone there’s was the best). If I could go to all the classes I would. I’m so excited to have my own wine and cheese parties because seriously my board is beautiful lol I have to show it off. GO SIGN UP!!! And show your boards off.

reviews.title: Charcuterie board workshop
text: Being a chef and enjoying the art of charcuterie technique I decided to sign up for this workshop Hosted by the custom table company. Let me tell I wasn't disappointed. The atmosphere when you walk in is very chill. Sarah makes everyone feel right at home. You start the night learning what to put on a charcuterie board and how to build it up. Then Sarah gives a brief description of the rest of the night.

Then it's off to the races as we get to pick the board we want off a wall of boards. From there Sarah shows us the technique of making the board from de barking it right to standing it down and then finishing it with oil.
Overall a great night out. Got to create a wooden board that I will put to good use. I highly recommend to take the workshop its a blast.

reviews.title: Best Friday!
text: I can't tell you how many compliments I've received on the beautiful charcuterie board I made at this class! What a great night of learning and creating, all while having the best time with the friends I had with me. Music, wine, charcuterie styling tips (on a spread that was almost too pretty to eat!), and then moving over to the charcuterie board workstations. It was a professional, clean space and the instructor (Sarah) was knowledgeable and fun - she fosters a really comfortable space to learn and work in. I'll likely be back with my work team for this workshop!

reviews.title: Unique and super satisfying experience
text: It was so great to work with my hands and create something I will actually be able to use. Sarah was very professional and the atmosphere was very relaxed and not intimidating. Not to mention the charcuterie board Boni put together for us was delicious!! I would definitely recommend. Great for a solo experience or with friends.

reviews.title: LOVED Sarah’s charcuterie board workshop!!
text: My bf and I did his workshop together and had the best time! We learned a lot about the types of wood available and what each needs, how it ages, and more. It was great to spend time in the shop and see how things are done. The wine and charcuterie was a treat, and made it feel like a night out. We will be back for another one!

reviews.title: The Custom Table Company’s charcuterie class
text: This was sooo fun! We had wine and got to eat the best charcuterie mix. I loved making my board, Sarah the host was so nice and made the environment so welcoming. Can’t wait to use my new board!

reviews.title: Learning a new skill whilst eating, drinking & meeting new friends? YES PLEASE.
text: Started the evening meeting Sarah (who is the friendliest person on the planet) and then watched whilst the girls took us through styling our new boards which really takes the class to another level - no point having a great board if you don't know how to place all the food!  And then you get to eat it whilst drinking a glass of wine and Sarah explains a bit about the boards.  Now it's time to make them - Sarah walks you through each step and we get to work - it's not too difficult and the end result is unbelievable.  Considering how much you pay in a store for one of these boards - this is a much more cost effective way to do it and makes for a great night out!  Highly recommended! Thanks Sarah for a great night!
